com.shc.silenceengine.core

Class Display

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shc.silenceengine.core.Display

  • public final class Display
extends java.lang.Object
    The Display class takes care of creating a display and managing it. As a user of SilenceEngine, I don't expect you to create the Display, the display creation will be handled automatically by the Game class.

    • Field Detail

      • mouseX

        public static int mouseX

      • mouseY

        public static int mouseY

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public static void create()
        Creates the default display, in windowed mode, initially hidden.

      • show

        public static void show()
        Makes the display visible to the users.

      • isCloseRequested

        public static boolean isCloseRequested()
        Returns:
        true if the user has clicked the close button, or pressed platform specific close shortcut keys like Cmd-Q(Mac) or Alt-F4 (linux & windows)

      • setViewport

        public static void setViewport(int x,
                               int y,
                               int width,
                               int height)
        Sets the viewport of the display.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the top-left point
        y - The y-coordinate of the top-left point
        width - The width of the window
        height - The height of the window

      • hide

        public static void hide()
        Hides the display from being shown to the user.

      • destroy

        public static void destroy()
        Destroy the display, will be unusable until create is called. Please don't call this method in between frames, unless you are keenly awaiting for a number of runtime exceptions to be thrown.

      • update

        public static void update()
        Updates the display. Swaps the buffers and polls new events.

      • getDisplayHandle

        public static long getDisplayHandle()
        Returns:
        the handle of the current display. Please don't store this handle, and always use this method to get one, because a stored handle can get invalid at any time.

      • getHeight

        public static int getHeight()
        Returns:
        the height of the display

      • setHeight

        public static void setHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of the display, measured in screen coordinates.
        Parameters:
        height - The height of the window

      • getWidth

        public static int getWidth()
        Returns:
        The width of the display, in screen coordinates.

      • setWidth

        public static void setWidth(int width)
        Sets the width of the display, in screen coordinates.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the window.

      • getAspectRatio

        public static float getAspectRatio()
        Returns:
        The aspect ratio of the Display

      • centerOnScreen

        public static void centerOnScreen()
        Centers the display on screen.

      • setPosition

        public static void setPosition(int x,
                               int y)
        Sets the window position on the screen
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the window (in screen coordinates)
        y - The y-coordinate of the window (in screen coordinates)

      • setClearColor

        public static void setClearColor(Color c)
        Sets the clear color of the Display, i.e., the background color
        Parameters:
        c - The background color to clear the window

      • isFullScreen

        public static boolean isFullScreen()
        Returns:
        whether the Display is fullscreen or not

      • setFullScreen

        public static void setFullScreen(boolean fullScreen)
        Sets the state of fullscreen of the Display.
        Parameters:
        fullScreen - If true, window will be made fullscreen

      • getTitle

        public static java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns:
        The title of the Display

      • setTitle

        public static void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title of the Display
        Parameters:
        title - The title of the window

      • wasResized

        public static boolean wasResized()
        Returns:
        True if the display has been resized

      • hideCursor

        public static void hideCursor()
        Hides the cursor over the Display

      • showCursor

        public static void showCursor()
        Shows the cursor over the Display
